at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.monitoring

Interface IMetricsDatabase

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InMemMetricsDatabase

    public interface IMetricsDatabase
extends Closeable
    This is the general interface for databases of monitoring metric values in JCloudScale. The database supports both, a pull (retrieve values per metric name) and a push (register callbakc listeners) model of data retrieval.

    Conceptually, this database is read-only. No functionality is provided to remove values once they are in the database. However, different implementations will employ different strategies to timeout and remove old values.

    Users should only use the database to query data. Although methods are provided to also write to the database, most applications should only query and/or register for values. The main source of values should be the JCloudScale CEP engine (EventCorrelationEngine).

    Author:
    philipp

    • Method Detail

      • addValue

        void addValue(String metricName,
            Object value,
            long timestamp)
        Adds a new value to the metrics database. Every value needs to have an associated timestamp. If the overload without timestamp is used, the current system time is used as timestamp.

        Note that, in principle, only the JCloudScale CEP engine is supposed to add values to the database. For other consumers, the database should be considered read-only.

        Parameters:
        metricName - The name of the metric to add a value to.
        value - The concrete value to add. For most use cases, all values of a given metric should have the same runtime type, but the metrics database should not be expected to enforce this.
        timestamp - The timestamp to associate with this value

      • addValue

        void addValue(String metricName,
            Object value)
        Adds a new value to the metrics database. Every value needs to have an associated timestamp. If the overload without timestamp is used, the current system time is used as timestamp.

        Note that, in principle, only the JCloudScale CEP engine is supposed to add values to the database. For other consumers, the database should be considered read-only.

        Parameters:
        metricName - The name of the metric to add a value to.
        value - The concrete value to add. For most use cases, all values of a given metric should have the same runtime type, but the metrics database should not be expected to enforce this.

      • getValues

        Collection<Object> getValues(String metricName)
        Get all values for a given metric. The returned values will be sorted according to their associated timestamp (descending).
        Parameters:
        metricName - The metric to get the values for.
        Returns:
        A sorted list of values (sorted descending after their timestamp).

      • getValuesSince

        Collection<Object> getValuesSince(String metricName,
                                long timestamp)
        Get all values for a given metric that are younger than a given timestamp. The returned values will be sorted according to their associated timestamp (descending).
        Parameters:
        metricName - The metric to get the values for.
        timestamp - Get all values that are younger than this timestamp.
        Returns:
        A sorted list of values (sorted descending after their timestamp).

      • getLastValue

        Object getLastValue(String metricName)
        Get the very last value that has been received for a given metric. This is a useful helper, as very often users will be interested not in the historic trend of a metric, but only in what the value is right now (or the closest approximation of 'right now', which is the last value we know of).
        Parameters:
        metricName - The metric to get the last value for.
        Returns:
        The last known value for this metric.

      • getTimestampToValue

        long getTimestampToValue(String metricName,
                       Object value)
        As all the getters of MetricsDatabase only return values (but not their timestamp), this method allows to get the timestamp associated with a concrete value for a metric.
        Parameters:
        metricName - The name of the metric that this value is associated with.
        value - The concrete value to get the timestamp for.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of this value.

      • registerCallbackForMetric

        UUID registerCallbackForMetric(String metricName,
                             IMetricsCallback callback)
        Register a new callback listener for a metric. Note that you need to use exactly the same string name as the name of the metric is going to be. Currently, there is no subscription or pattern language for mass-subscibing more than one metric at the same time.
        Parameters:
        metricName - The name of the metric to register for.
        callback - An implementation of IMetricsCallback passed by the user. This callback will be notified whenever a new value comes in.
        Returns:
        An subscription ID. This is mainly useful if users want to unregister at a later point.

      • unregisterCallbackForMetric

        void unregisterCallbackForMetric(String metricName,
                               UUID registrationId)
        Unregister a callback. Callbacks are identified via their callback ID, which is generated and returned as part of the registration process.
        Parameters:
        metricName - The name of the metric that this callback was registered to.
        registrationId - The registration ID that has been returned when this listener was originally registered.

      • registerEventDrivenScalingPolicy

        UUID registerEventDrivenScalingPolicy(String metricName,
                                    AbstractEventDrivenScalingPolicy policy)
        Register a new event-driven scaling policy, which should be triggered whenever a given value for a monitoring metric is received.
        Parameters:
        metricName - The name of the metric to register for.
        callback - An implementation of at.ac.tuwien.infosys.jcloudscale.policy.IEventDrivenScalingPolicy passed by the user. This callback will be notified whenever a new value comes in.
        Returns:
        An subscription ID. This is mainly useful if users want to unregister at a later point.

      • unregisterEventDrivenScalingPolicy

        void unregisterEventDrivenScalingPolicy(String metricName,
                                      UUID registrationId)
        Unregister an event-driven scaling policy. Scaling policiesare identified via their ID, which is generated and returned as part of the registration process.
        Parameters:
        metricName - The name of the metric that this policy was registered to.
        registrationId - The registration ID that has been returned when this listener was originally registered.
